title: FIFA Team of the Year: FIFPro World XI includes Ronaldo, Messi, Neymar and Pogba
title_page: FIFA Team of the Year: FIFPro World XI includes Ronaldo, Messi, Neymar and Pogba | Daily Mail Online
text:
Marcelo, Thiago Silva, Sergio Ramos and Dani Alves are in defence
Andres Iniesta, Paul Pogba and Luka Modric are in midfield
BALLON D'OR 2015 WINNERS: Ballon d'Or: Lionel Messi (Barcelona) Men's Coach of the Year: Luis Enrique (Barcelona) Women's Coach of the Year: Jill Ellis (USA) Puskas Award: Wendell Lira (Vila Nova) Women's Player of the Year: Carli Lloyd (USA)
FIFA have announced their FIFPro World XI for 2015, with all three nominees of the individual Ballon d'Or award making the line-up in attack.
Real Madrid's Cristiano Ronaldo is joined by Barcelona pair Lionel Messi and Neymar up front, while Andres Iniesta (Barcelona), Luka Modric (Real Madrid) and Paul Pogba (Juventus) occupy the midfield spots in a 4-3-3 formation.
Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer has been selected between the posts with Marcelo (Real Madrid), Thiago Silva (PSG), Sergio Ramos (Real Madrid) and Dani Alves (Barcelona) in defence.
L-R: Thiago Silva, Luka Modric Marcelo, Paul Pogba, Sergio Ramos, Neymar, Dani Alves, Lionel Messi, Andres Iniesta and Cristiano Ronaldo pose after being selected in FIFA's FIFPro World XI for 2015
Ex-Barcelona striker Samuel Eto'o (left) presents Marcelo with his award for making the Team of the Year
Eto'o, now playing for Antalyaspor, hands Thiago Silva his award after making the FIFPro World XI
L-R: Neymar, Alves, Messi, Iniesta and Ronaldo are all smiles as they make FIFA's Team of the Year for 2015
Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer tunes into the Ballon d'Or ceremony live on TV from his home
LEAGUE BREAKDOWN: La Liga 8 Bundesliga 1 Ligue 1 1 Serie A 1
The Premier League was the only of Europe's top five divisions not to have a representative in the team.
Spain's La Liga led the way by a considerable distance with eight players, while Germany's Bundesliga, France's Ligue 1 and Italy's Serie A each had one.
NATIONALITY BREAKDOWN: Germany 1 Spain 2 Argentina 1 Brazil 4 Portugal 1 Croatia 1 France 1
Brazil internationals Neymar, Alves, Silva and Marcelo were the dominant nationality, while Spaniards Ramos and Iniesta signaled the next most common in the team.
Neuer (Germany), Ronaldo (Portugal), Modric (Croatia) and Pogba (France) were each the only player from their home country.
Barcelona, who enjoyed phenomenal success in 2015, winning five trophies including the Champions League, had four players out of the 11.
Madrid, despite not winning any honours last year, also took four places.
